title: 114_hr5770
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016" establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. The plan covers veterans enrolled in the patient enrollment system and survivors or dependents eligible for medical care. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the plan, providing benefits for dental care and treatment. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the dental insurance plan, providing benefits for dental care and treatment. Enrollment in the plan is voluntary, with premiums adjusted annually to cover all associated costs. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the voluntary dental insurance plan, with premiums adjusted annually to cover all costs. Individuals enrolled must pay the full premium and copayments, with the option for voluntary disenrollment within 30 days of enrollment. The dental insurance plan allows for voluntary disenrollment within 30 days of enrollment, with specific circumstances prescribed by the Secretary to prevent abuse and maintain fiscal integrity. These circumstances include relocation outside the plan's jurisdiction, serious medical conditions preventing benefit use, and other situations determined by the Secretary. The dental insurance plan allows for voluntary disenrollment within 30 days of enrollment under specific circumstances outlined by the Secretary to prevent abuse. These circumstances include serious medical conditions preventing benefit use and other situations determined by the Secretary. Procedures for determinations on disenrollments must be established to ensure timely decisions. The plan does not affect the Secretary's responsibility to provide dental care under section 1712, and regulations for the plan will be administered as prescribed by the Secretary. The dental insurance plan under this section will not impact an individual's entitlement to outpatient dental services and treatment. The plan will be administered according to regulations set by the Secretary and will terminate on December 31, 2021. A clerical amendment will be made to the table of sections in chapter 17 of the title. The dental insurance plan for veterans and survivors, as well as dependents of veterans, is established. Section 510 of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 is repealed, and a clerical amendment is made to the table of contents.
